intro: Gymnorebutia pulquinensis, commonly known as the Pachyveria pulquinensis, is a species of flowering plant native to the Andes mountains in South America. It belongs to the family Aizoaceae, commonly known as the ice plant family, and is characterized by its succulent, fleshy stems and leaves. The plant produces small, star-shaped flowers in shades of yellow and orange, typically during the spring and summer seasons. Gymnorebutia pulquinensis is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments, making it a resilient plant suitable for rock gardens and xeriscaping. Its compact growth habit and ornamental flowers make it a popular choice among succulent enthusiasts.
